Week 3 & 4 updates for FREEFLO with BFLO for YESS!
Emerging from the Chrysalis
Helloo all! Our build is on! We have worked with our partner RSN on their verification standard and processes to confirm. It's been great to affirm what we are building is relevant to the real world use case of global divestment of cotton from supply chain.
<https://kernelofbflo.substack.com/p/emerging-from-the-chrysalis>
Yeah for sure I am free all week in the evenings. Your midday ish. Just send me a time.

<@UN4CVDLJ3> this sounds amazing! let us know what you have in mind.

I have been hoping to connect with you this week to do a proof of concept with the project for the cotton farmers and the reputation based credits. Can we check in on that?
yes!

Hey guys, just an update from me, I am currently putting together a DAO for a  carbon offset supply chain. So far we have a LidAR drone scanning carbon attestation platform, carbon credit attestation system, and us Creol for consumption of these credits within the built environement. If this is something that interests you guys let me know. I intend to deploy a testnet DAO this week that we will test around with.

<!channel>
It's been exciting to have so much progress - like the pupa in the cocoon, what is amorphous is now taking shape!

I just saw the email from Vivek that we have another breath as they re pushing the Aug 10th date...which I'm glad about.

August 15th,Â August 17th, andÂ August 19thÂ (delayed from next Monday -- perhaps a relief to some of you!) are the three days we are planning to host demo's for KERNEL Expo Week."
Wicked. Let me know how I can be helpful
<@U016Q825Y3U> responded in our dev channel. Love to meet 2 hours later as that's super early here still for cognitive conversation ~ :)

hi all, are folks available tomorrow morning between 9:30-11:30 am ET?  I'd love to get those thinking about the technical pieces of this around the dashboard, how to set up the data reporting for FreeFLO, any thoughts on oracles for that (e.g. the mobile app/QR scanner for data providers I've proposed)
Even John Oliver is talking about it <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=17oCQakzIl8>

Hello world - I am seeing this everywhere now....

...something to be said for second hand clothes....

<https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/28/style/malaysia-forced-labor-garment-workers.html>

Hello Hello!

Here is our project update! Week 2!
<https://kernelofbflo.substack.com/p/a-journey-though-the-underbelly>

Hey Folks - looking for folks to participate in a mini market research study around our project mid week.

Freeflo is the safeguard system for BFLO to provide risk management for buyers of fiber with verification of slavery free commodities. We are building the grievance mechanism to demonstrate methods of inputs for ground truth with the use case of Chinaâ€™s Uighur ethic group currently being challenged due to forced labor conditions. 

We are working with a coalition of NGOs focused on this project.

While we arenâ€™t ready for used testing as this is a new project associated with our protocol, Iâ€™m opening up our ask for feedback loops to scout on folks willing to do a mini market research study of:

-  brand customers (we all buy clothes), 
- as well as a powerful service for social justice here at home 

In addition to feedback on the Uighur cotton project, weâ€™d love to hear thoughts of folks on the use of the system for other applications.

<https://thehill.com/changing-america/enrichment/arts-culture/508736-amazon-costco-other-major-brands-complicit-in-forced>
I may have some UK based cotton innovators that may be interested in collaborating. They are called Hydrocotton. I can provide an intro if it's something that is of interest.
I love this! <@UN4CVDLJ3> let's explore this for SURE!

<https://www.hydrocotton.tech/>

Have a look at their site. I know the founders Ed and Ed.
<@UN4CVDLJ3> Projct is awesome I'd love to understand how it would tie in with our use case....in your imagination :slightly_smiling_face:

They basically have the ability to produce high grade cotton in a way that uses 90% less water and no pesticides. I've been helping them flesh out their blockchain tracking integration as well. It'd be interesting if you could integrate their results into your SDG tracker as the cotton is grown also locally in the UK. So no shipping from Asia required. They want to track specific batches as well all the way through the cotton supply chain. Which is quite difficult I'm told as theres many many stakeholders.
Love to! Thank you!
